sentences.en: First he had been numb. Then the numbness gave way to anger.
sentences.cn: 起初他只是麻木，接着转为了愤怒。

sentences.en: He could feel his fingers growing numb at their tips.
sentences.cn: 他能感到指尖正在变得麻木。

sentences.en: Her lower members were numb with cold.
His dogs were numb with cold.
His fingers were numb with cold.
I don't feel so cold now; but heavy and numb.
sentences.cn: 我现在感到不那么冷了, 只是觉得困乏,浑身僵硬.

sentences.en: I had been lying awkwardly and my leg had gone numb.
sentences.cn: 我一直以一种不舒服的姿势躺着,腿已经麻木了.

sentences.en: I was so shocked I went numb.

sentences.cn: 迈克尔把头转了过来,头非常沉重 、 麻木.

sentences.en: My fingers are numb with cold.
My fingers were so numb I could hardly write.
sentences.cn: 我的手指麻木得几乎没法写字。

sentences.en: My fingersare numb [ stiff ] with cold.
My legs felt numb and my toes ached.
Numb with terror, she stared at the departing maraud-ers.
sentences.cn: 她吓得呆若木鸡，眼睁睁地看着劫匪们离去。

sentences.en: The anaesthetic made his whole face go numb.
sentences.cn: 麻醉剂使他整个脸都失去了知觉。

sentences.en: The cold had numbed her fingers.
The mother, numb with grief, has trouble speaking.
sentences.cn: 那位母亲因过于悲痛而说不出话来。

sentences.en: the numbing effect of the drug

words.tran_cn: 使麻木的；使失去感觉的
使麻木；使发愣；使失去感觉

trans.tran_en: a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold
to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
